metadata.Title: CVE-2020-19909 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** Integer overflow vulnerability in tool_operate.c in curl 7.65.2 via a large value as the retry delay. NOTE: many parties report that this has no direct security impact on the curl user; however, it may (in theory) cause a denial of service to associated systems or networks if, for example, --retry-delay is misinterpreted as a value much smaller than what was intended. This is not especially plausible because the overflow only happens if the user was trying to specify that curl should wait weeks (or longer) before trying to recover from a transient error.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-19909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
libcurl3-nss - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
libcurl4 - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE is not a security issue, and the curl author intends on disputing this CVE. Marking as not-affected. eslerm> MITRE refused upstream request to reject CVE

criterions.comment: curl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19').
